content.value:
Use the following table to help locate the documentation appropriate to your understanding and requirements of the feature engineering workflow:

Topic Describes...
Create a project Create projects with secondary datasets, including a simple use-case-based workflow overview.
Time-aware feature engineering Configure time-aware feature engineering.
Derived Features Introduction to the list of aggregations and the feature reduction process.
Predictions Score data with models created using secondary datasets.
Feature considerations Considerations to be aware of when working with secondary datasets.

In most cases, all you need to start is a simple training dataset that includes:

  • The target (column that you want to predict).
  • An identifier (e.g., customer_id, transaction_id,...) to link the dataset to additional related datasets.
  • A date feature in the primary table that is then used as the point for generating new features (prediction point).

From this primary dataset, DataRobot guides you through creating relationships to additional datasets, called secondary datasets. The end result is a multitude of additional features that will be used to train more accurate models and generate predictions.

hits.title: Feature Discovery
